intro: Matricaria szowitzii, commonly known as the Hungarian chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flower heads surrounded by white ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their calming properties. Matricaria szowitzii is closely related to other chamomile species but is distinguished by its unique floral structure and chemical composition.
